title.narrative: OUTPUT 1.5 NUTRITION SYSTEMS STRENGTHENING

description.narrative: Output 1.5 Nutrition systems in Yemen are better able to support delivery of multi-sectorial nutrition interventions, including both preventive and curative care at facility and community levels., which contributes to Early Detection And Treatment Of Malnutrition, Evaluation, Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Nutrition In Early Childhood, Nutrition Of Adolescents And Women, Research, Strengthening Primary Health Care And High-Impact Health Interventions. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, more vulnerable neonates, infants and children survive and thrive and fewer women die during pregnancy and childbirth

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 1.5 Nutrition systems in Yemen are better able to support delivery of multi-sectorial nutrition interventions, includingboth preventive and curative care at facility and community levels.

description.narrative: In 2021, UNICEF technical and financial support to nutrition surveys enabled improved quality of assessment and monitoring of trends at livelihoods and Governorates level and subsequently informed ongoing IPC AMN and humanitarian needs in Yemen. A total of 39 nutrition surveys have been conducted out of the 44 planned. UNICEF’s contribution to strengthening nutrition systems resulted its support to routine data collection, development of Yemen Action plan to reduce wasting, risk monitoring framework and three-year multi-agency nutrition information system plan aimed at improving nutrition information to provide reliable evidence-based planning, risk monitoring and situation analysis in Yemen. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:16/01/2022
